libplot module¶

Auxiliary routines required for plotting

class libplot.DragableLabel(label)¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtCore.QObject

connect()¶

connect to all the events we need

disconnect()¶

disconnect all the stored connection ids

labelsChanged¶
on_motion(event)¶

on motion we will move the rect if the mouse is over us

on_press(event)¶

Press catcher.

On button press we will see if the mouse is over us and store some data.

on_release(event)¶

on release we reset the press data

class libplot.LinePropertiesDialog(parent)¶

Bases: PyQt5.QtWidgets.QDialog

get_result()¶
set_initial(color, linestyle, linewidth)¶
libplot.evenscale(scale, *axes)¶

Given a collections of axes, sets the same x and/or y scale for all

Parameters:
  • scale (str) – The dimmension to act upon. Accepted values are ‘x’, ‘y’ or ‘xy’.
  • *axes (matplotlib.Axes) – The axes to act upon
Raises:

ValueError – if scale does not conform with the accepted values.
libplot.make_labels(label_seed, P)¶

This routine takes the names of the components (label_seed) and the matrix of stoichiometric coefficients and makes a list of species in equilibrium. For instance: if primary species are ‘L’ and ‘H’ and ‘L’ can take up to three protons (‘H’), the species in equilibrium are (including H-1): ‘L’, ‘H’, ‘HL’, ‘H_2L’, ‘H_3L’ and ‘H-1’ and that is the list returned.

Parameters:
  • labels_seed (list) – list of str with the bases for making the labels.
  • P (ndarray) – the stoichiometric coefficients.
Returns:

A list of strings with the constructed labels.
libplot.position_labels(x, y, window)¶

Returns a list of tuples containing the optimized positions for labels for the given data.

Parameters:
  • x (numpy.ndarray) – 1D array containing the independent variable
  • y (numpy.ndarray) – 2D array containing the data for the dependent variable
  • window (tuple) – tuple containing the limits of the plot ((x_min, x_max), (y_min, y_max))
Returns:

A list of 2-sized tuples containing the (x, y) coordinates calculated

for the labels.
